primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Subject (Hearer/David) seeks to attain 'Repose' (Object) by shifting focus from circumstances to the beauty of God, in order to withstand the 'terror of creation'.

tekstueel_bewijs: I want to dwell in your house.
You have to find time for it.

object.identificatie: Repose / Unbroken fellowship / Gazing on Beauty
tekstueel_bewijs: I want to experience your reality.
God alone is the place of peace.

zender.identificatie: The Preacher/Augustine (Source of the 'One Thing' mandate)
tekstueel_bewijs: What we’ve been doing this fall is looking at prayer...
Augustine says, on the one hand, that’s incredibly selfish...
If you have him, you have everything you need.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies strongly with the Subject who must perform the 'seeking'.

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ / The Holy Spirit / Spiritual Disciplines
tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ... is the reason why we can go in.
only a person whose heart has been regenerated... will ever find him beautiful.
helper.rol_van_god: God is primarily the Object (Beauty) and Helper (Jesus as bridge), while the Hearer remains the Subject.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help for the Subject's appreciation.

tegenstander.identificatie: The 'Terror of Creation' / Circumstances / Attachment to created things
tekstueel_bewijs: The rumble of panic underneath everything.
If you set your heart too much on anything in this world, you’re going to be held hostage.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is described as the existential dread of death and loss ('terror of creation').

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Soteriological Program: Jesus (Subject) takes the forsakenness (Object) of Man to provide access to God.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Jesus Christ
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon presents Christ's work as the 'competence' (Pouvoir-faire) that allows the Hearer to then perform the primary program of 'Repose'.

voorbeelden_god_subject: Jesus Christ said, 'My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?'
He will hide me in the shelter.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: You’re asking for a whole lot of things.
You need to realize that these are good things.
You have to find time for it.
I want to dwell in your house.

voorbeelden: You have to find time for it.
I want to experience your reality.
Notice what he’s facing, then what he does about it, then how he does it.
I have something that will overcome it.
Jesus... is the reason why we can go in.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is a 'Recruitment' narrative, focusing on awakening the hearer's desire (Vouloir) and providing the method (Savoir) to achieve spiritual peace.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from S2 (Terror) to ~S2 (Detachment/Ataraxia) which it rejects, then to ~S1 (Attachment/Anxiety), finally aiming for S1 (Repose).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by Christ taking the 'forsakenness' (S2) so the Subject can move to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. The 'terror of creation' is presented as an unavoidable reality.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon uses a Christocentric foundation at the end, the majority of the narrative engine is anthropocentric: the hearer is the Subject who must 'gaze', 'seek', and 'praise' to achieve the Object of peace.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: What he does about it... First of all, let me show you what he’s not doing.
I have something that’ll help me face it.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He was taking the forsakenness we deserve.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: David is used as the primary model for the hearer's prayer life.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on how God preserves David despite his fears, rather than how David manages his fears through 'one thing'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to perform spiritual 'gazing' to escape anxiety.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Sanctification is viewed as a technique of the soul.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'how-to' of David to the 'substitution' of Christ is somewhat abrupt but theologically linked via the Tabernacle imagery.
spanning_punten: The 'One Thing' is a mandate for the hearer, but the 'Forsakenness' is a work of Christ.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He was standing in your place. He was taking the forsakenness we deserve.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit enables the 'tasting' of the beauty, but the Subject must still 'seek'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Serious; it is the 'only sickness that can actually destroy me'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a manual for spiritual repose where the hearer is the primary actor, supported by Christ's past work.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the subject of 'gazing' and 'seeking'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make God the Subject who 'reveals' His beauty to the passive hearer.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'You must gaze on His beauty,' use 'God unveils His beauty to you in the midst of your terror.'

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize verse 10 (The Lord will take me up) over verse 4 (One thing I seek).

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus more on how the Spirit 'sheds love abroad' rather than how we 'find time' to praise.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon successfully avoids 'cheap grace' by acknowledging the weight of the opponent (death/loss).

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The 'Secondary Program' (Ethics/Prayer technique) precedes the 'Primary Program' (Soteriology).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Start with Christ's non-forsakenness as the ground that creates repose, rather than repose as a goal to be achieved by the hearer.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically brilliant and existentially deep, but structurally leans toward a 'spirituality of effort' until the final Christological turn.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is about 'peace'; actantially, it is about the hearer's 'quest' for peace.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Psalm 27; semiotics reveals that the preacher has cast the hearer as the 'hero' of the psalm.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that despite the 'grace' language, the 'Subject' of the active verbs of sanctification remains the 'I' of the hearer.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses 'Repose' as a value-object that is technically 'already there' but requires human 'Savoir-faire' to access.
